intro: Coelogyne psectrantha, commonly known as the golden orchid, is a tropical orchid native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its striking golden-yellow flowers and long, slender stems. The plant typically grows as an epiphyte, attaching itself to trees in its natural habitat. Its leaves are strap-like and dark green, often arranged in a rosette pattern. Coelogyne psectrantha blooms in late winter or early spring, making it a sought-after plant among orchid enthusiasts.
